dialogue: Yes! The quote about emotional intelligence was very-
Jacob’s idea.
Is this a good time for me to introduce the... interns-
Now is good!
It’s their first day so-
Hello!
This is our CEO, Romy Mathis!
Don’t be nervous...Welcome! We are so very happy to have you with us.
If you have any questions, let us know.
It’s really good to like think about death more.
What?
I mean, to like bring awareness to death more? Like that Buddhist quote. “We don’t give enough attention to the avalanche that will cover us all, in a very short time.”
Well, you’re still an embryo, so you shouldn't think about death at all! Leave that to us dinosaurs.
Can I ask you- Where does your first name come from? Is it Polish?
I was named by a guru.
What?? Seriously? How? When?
I was raised in cults and communes.
You were? I would have NEVER guessed. I thought you were raised by soldiers or something. Or robots!
I mean- I’m joking, of course.
Did you know him before?
Do you think I’m too young for fillers?
Why?
Barbara said I have a gummy smile.
Who? That’s insane, I hope you realize that.

Hazel thought it would be good for you to take part in some extra activities internally... They say there’s a talent war-so I guess it’s important to make new talent feel involved. Show you’re an approachable leader-
Yes- The talent war-
You think we can talk about my promotion soon?
Of course-
You have seven minutes.
You would?
See?
Did you order this?
Come in!
You don’t mind, do you?
No, of course not.
What are you doing?
Yes! Please, can you clean that up?
It’s a lovely party.
Come in.
You wanted to see me?
Yes! Hi! Sit down.
How are you?
Well. Thank you. You?
How is Samuel?
What? I thought we were going to talk about-
I just wanted to make sure everything is ok, since we’re supposed to discuss your future soon-
Yes. I know. I mean, that’s what I-
You have to be careful, Esme, he’s an intern.
I don’t want to sound dramatic, but you’re in a position of power over him.
Oh- Ehh- we’ve just been hanging out- As friends. We’re not-
You can tell me anything. You know that, right?
I didn’t think it would be a big deal to bring him- but you’re right. I am so sorry-
I just want to protect you.
Sorry, one moment-
I genuinely thought women with power would behave differently than men with power.
What makes you say that?
I tried to speak to you so many times about my future at the company.
I know. I’m sorry. We can discuss it now. We all went through- a hard time, but it paid off. You were part of that, Esme. Part of the team who made it happen.
I don’t want you to make any promises because you’re afraid of me.
I’m not afraid of you.
I know what’s going on between you and Samuel.
I only want what I deserve, not what is given to me, to silence me. That’s how it might have worked when you were young, but luckily, those days are behind us now.
I don’t know what you’re talking about.
You will never see Samuel again. You will be a good leader and you will create more opportunities for women within the company, and be a good example and role model to us all.
You’re confusing ambition with morality, those are very different things.

I have no interest in taking you down. You are one of the few women who made it to the top, my interest is to keep you there. But not like you are now... As a version of you that I can look up to and respect.
